layer.name: Discipline
layer.definition: Do what needs doing, especially when you don't feel like it.

questions.text: When I feel conviction in my heart, I ...
questions.principle: Don't let things fester; face what you're avoiding

answers.4: usually confess and repent fairly promptly, though occasionally I resist
answers.5: stop, confess, and repent without delay — conviction is a gift
answers.2: feel it but usually minimize or tell myself I'll deal with it later
answers.3: sometimes respond quickly, other times let it sit for days or weeks
answers.1: have learned to tune it out — it's just guilt I don't need

questions.text: During dry seasons when I don't feel God's presence, I ...
questions.principle: Consistency regardless of feeling; the discipline creates the result

answers.4: mostly maintain disciplines, though my commitment wavers
answers.5: show up whether it feels fruitful or not — feelings aren't my gauge
answers.2: get knocked off my disciplines quickly — I need to feel something to continue
answers.3: persist for a while but eventually drift away until things feel better
answers.1: stop showing up — what's the point?

questions.text: My approach to areas of habitual sin is ...
questions.principle: Take responsibility; don't rationalize weakness as identity

answers.4: active work — slow but real progress on most areas
answers.5: warfare — habitual sin is an enemy to defeat, not a roommate to tolerate
answers.2: resignation — I've given up trying to change
answers.3: occasional effort — but I quickly return to old patterns
answers.1: acceptance — they're permanent features of who I am

questions.text: My approach to spiritual renewal is ...
questions.principle: Boundaries around spiritual refueling; sustainable holiness

answers.4: mostly proactive — I usually keep my tank reasonably full
answers.5: scheduled and protected — I don't wait until I'm empty
answers.2: rare — I know I need it but rarely make time until crisis hits
answers.3: inconsistent — I often let myself get depleted before I seek it
answers.1: reactive — I run on fumes until I'm empty, then wonder why I feel disconnected

questions.text: When I'm alone and tempted to cut a corner, I ...
questions.principle: Private behavior predicts public character; small disciplines reveal true state

answers.4: usually hold, though I slip sometimes
answers.5: hold — who I am doesn't depend on who's watching
answers.2: cut it if it's not hurting anyone
answers.3: sometimes hold, sometimes cut — depends on the moment
answers.1: cut it — no one will know

remediation.advice: Holiness isn't perfection — it's direction. As Jordan Peterson teaches, you must face what you're avoiding. Identify ONE area of compromise you've been tolerating. Confess it. Make a plan to address it.

scripture.text: He who conceals his transgressions will not prosper, but he who confesses and forsakes them will find compassion.
